data.comment: The Header of Settings in the Ribbon Back Stage

data.name: findReplace_HeaderFind
data.comment: The Header for the Find Dialog

data.name: findReplace_HeaderReplace
data.comment: The Header for the Replace Dialog

data.name: findReplace_NoMoreOccurencesFound
data.value: No more occurences of search string found

data.name: screentip_AutoNumberText
data.value: The track number of the selected song is set using the value in the text box as the start number.

data.name: screentip_BPMText
data.value: Analyses the selected file and calculates the Beats per Minute (BPM). The calcualted value is written into the Tags. Note: The file itself is not modified.

data.name: screentip_CaseConversionText
data.value: Case Conversion Rules, as set in the options, are applied on all selected files.

data.name: screentip_DeleteLayoutText
data.value: The layout of the regions in the Docking Manager is saved upon exit and reused at the next start of the application. Use this function to return to the default application layout.

data.name: screentip_DeleteTagsText
data.value: All tags are removed from the selected files.

data.name: screentip_ExecuteScriptText
data.value: Applies the script in the combo box to the selected files.

data.name: screentip_FindText
data.value: Opens the find dialog to search for the specified string in the songs displayed in the grid.

data.name: screentip_FixSongText
data.value: Uses MP3Val to fix errors detected in the selected MP3 File.

data.name: screentip_GetLyricsText
data.value: Lyrics for the selected songs is searched on various Lyrics sources checked in the dialog.

data.name: screentip_IdentifyFileText
data.value: A hash is built over the first 30 seconds of the file. This hash is then used to identify the file on MusicBrainz. The tags are then retrieved from MusicBrainz and written to the file.

data.name: screentip_NumberOnClickText
data.value: While the button is toggled on, a click on a file sets the track number.

data.name: screentip_OrganiseText
data.value: The files are copied/moved to a new location based on their tag values as specified in the dialog parameters.

data.name: screentip_RefreshText
data.value: The content of the currently selected folder is reread. If changes are pending, the system asks if the changes should be saved first.

data.name: screentip_RemoveCommentsText
data.value: All comments found in the selected files are removed.

data.name: screentip_RenameFileText
data.value: The files are renamed according to the parameters specified in the dialog.

data.name: screentip_ReplaceText
data.value: Opens the Find / Replace dialog to replace a specified search string in the songs displayed in the grid.

data.name: screentip_ReplayGainText
data.value: Analyses the selected file and calculates the Replay Gain. The calcualted value is written into the Tags. Note: The file itself is not modified.

data.name: screentip_ResetLayoutText
data.value: The layout of the regions in the Docking Manager is reset to the Application Default.

data.name: screentip_SaveText
data.value: Saves pending changes to disk and changes the tags of all selected songs.

data.name: screentip_TagFromFileText
data.value: Using specific parameters given in the dialog, the various tags like "Track #", "Artist", "Title", etc. are extracted out of the filename.

data.name: screentip_TagFromInternetText
data.value: The given Artist and Album Name are used for a lookup at online sources, like Discogs, Last.FM and MusicBrainz, trying to match the filenames to the list retrieved from the online sources

data.name: screentip_ValidateSongText
data.value: Uses MP3Val to validate the correctness of the selected MP3 File. Some errors may be fixed using the "Fix MP3" Button

data.name: lookup_NoAlbumFound
data.value: No album found, please choose another selection criteria.

data.name: lookup_SongsToTag
data.value: Songs to Tag (Use Drag & Drop to reorder)

data.comment: The Header of the Internet Lookup Dialog

data.name: screentip_GetCoverArtText
data.value: Cover Art for the selected songs is search on the various selected sites

data.name: tagEdit_TabHeader_Web_Information
data.comment: The Header for the Web Information Tab

data.name: tagEdit_Rating_Note
data.value:
As per ID3 standard the rating is 1-255 where 1 is worst and 255 is best. 0 is unknown.
Many programs have their own rating and may redefine the ID3 standard, like a Star Rating from 1 - 5 that is used by MPTagThat.
If no personal counter is wanted it may be omitted.
To change the order of the ratings drag the rows.
